error.signature: Error: Too many re-renders. React limits the number of renders to prevent an infinite loop
error.regex: Too many re-renders.*React limits the number of renders

verdict.summary: Infinite render loop caused by setState during render or wrong useEffect dependencies.

dead_ends.why_fails: There is no configurable render limit; the issue is an infinite loop
Makes useEffect run on every render, potentially worsening the loop

workarounds.action: Check for setState calls during render (not inside useEffect or event handlers)
Fix useEffect dependency arrays to prevent retriggering

leads_to.condition: Fixing the loop may move setState to wrong phase of render cycle

preceded_by.condition: Fixing render-phase update by adding useEffect causes infinite loop
Fixing hook placement introduces dependency array issues

frequently_confused_with.distinction: Cannot update while rendering is about state update timing; too many re-renders is about infinite render loops
